title: BALLING HISTORY PROJECT!!!
name: BALLING HISTORY PROJECT!!!
description:
A Map by Ilovepeter11

This is a map about 10 places in the world that are concidered sacred or holy/  Theese locations are historically valuable toward religion.

properties.name: Bethlehem
properties.description: Posted by Ilovepeter11Bethlehem, IsraelBethlehem, Israel was the birthplace of Jesus Christ. Bethlehem is located about six miles south of Jerusalem. Christians look to Bethlehem as the birthplace of the Messiah. Jews, on the other hand, revere Bethlehem for a different reason, it was the birth place and home town of King David. Bethlehem is home to one of the largest amout of Arib Christians in the Middle East. It also serves as the home to muslims. Some of the most popualr actractions in Bethlehem are the Church of the Nativity, Rachael\'s tomb, the Shepard\'s Feilds, and Old Town. Though it sounds as though there are many actractions, Bethlehem is not an extremely touristy town.

properties.name: Death Valley
properties.description: Posted by Ilovepeter11death valley, califorinaSome of the hottest, driest spots in North America are located in Death Vally. Regardless of the haunting name, there are actually some extremely beautiful sights. For five months out of the year, Death Valley is consumed in unbearable heat. In 1913 Death Valley had a recorded 5 days with tempatures over 129 degreese. Rain is rarely ever seen in Death Valley, but the rain that DOES manage to make it past the mountians are what keep the garden of wildflowers alive. Over 1000 different types of plants live in Death Valley. There are some places to stay near Death Valley if one would enjoy a hot and perhaps educational vacation.

properties.name: Mt. Rushmore
properties.description: Posted by Ilovepeter11Location Mt. Rushmore is located 23 miles southwest of Rapid City. The Sculptor\'s name was Gutzon Borglum.Borglum chose this this mountian because of it\'s height, it is granite, and because it recives lots of sunlight throughout the day. Mt. Rushmore has the heads of four American presidents: Washington, Jefferson, Lincoln, and Roosevelt. Washington represents the struggle for independence. Jefferson represents the concept of government by the people. Lincoln represents equailty, and Roosevelt represents Americia\'s involvement and importance in 20th century affaris. Mt. Rushmore is a free attraction that is highly recomended for families.

properties.name: Roman Colosseum
properties.description: Posted by Ilovepeter11Rome, ItalyThe Roman Colosseum was started in 80 A.D. It was the first permanant amphitheater in Rome. The monumental building was perfectly efficent for controlling large crowds. The amphitheater can seat up to 50,000 people. Under the seating area, was a wooden area which held the animals and other things needed for the shows. There were about eighty ways to enter the coloseum. This caused easy entrance and exit flow. The amphitheater spanned over 6 acres. Shows and circuses were held in the amphitheater. Chariot races were the most popular event held in the Colosseum. Also, criminals were sometimes exicuted duirng a sort of show were they were in a fight with a wild beast. Today shows and concerts are still held at the Roman Colosseum.

properties.name: Sistine Chapel
properties.description: Posted by Ilovepeter11LocationThe Sistine Chapel is the home of the Pope. The first mass held in the Sistine Chapel was on 9 August 1843, the ceremony was dedicated to the Virgin Mary. The Sistine Chapel\'s archeticture resembles many other Medieval and Renaissance churchs built in Italy. There are many famous series of paintings located in the Sistine Chapel. Some examples are The Temptation of Christ, Scenes From the Life of Moses, and The Last Judgment. The Sistine Chapel is probably most famous for it\'s ceiling painting by Michelangelo Buonarroti. The ceiling originally had gold stars, but Michelangelo painted more than 300 biblical characters and symbols on the ceiling. It took him four years to complete the task. Tours of the Sistine Chapel are offered.

properties.name: The Alamo
properties.description: Posted by Ilovepeter11San Antonio, TxThe Alamo is located in San Antonio, Texas. Construction began in 1924. For nearly seventy years, the Alamo served as a home for missionaries and their Indian converts. In the early 1800\'s Spanish military set up at the old mission. The soliders who were there were from the town Alamo de Parras, Coahuila, in honor of their hometown, they called it the Alamo, meaning "cottonwood". The Alamo played an important role in the Texas Revolution. It has become a majior tourist actraction. More than 2.5 million people visit yearly. Admission to the Alamo is free. And is opened 9:00 to 5:30 Mondays through Saturdays and 10:00 to 5:30 on Sundays. I recomend visiting the Alamo because it is such a historical place.

properties.name: The White House
properties.description: Posted by Ilovepeter11Washington D.CThe White House is located in our nation\'s capital, Washington D.C. The first President to live in the White House was John Adams in 1800. In 1833 the first piped water system was installed. The first heating system was installed in 1840. The White House was burned in 1814 by the British during the war of 1812. There are many White House traditions that have been kept alive throughout the years. The annual Easter Egg Roll and Thanksgiving Dinner are just two examples. Guided tours of the White House are offered in groups up to ten people. Self guided tours are also an option.

properties.name: Westminister Abbey
properties.description: Posted by Ilovepeter11London, EnglandWestminster Abbey has more than 1,000 years of history. The monks that came to Westminister Abbey during the middle of the tenth century started the religious practices that are still in use today. Westminister Abbey is the coronation church of England and has been since 1066. It is a place filled with stained glass, paintings, textiles, and other artifacts. It even has a library full of important scripts. Westminister Abbey is known for it\'s extravigant architecture. It also has a world famous music tradition. The music trations were originated by the monks. Throughout the centuries many gifted musicians have preformed at Westminister. THe monarchy has always played an important role with the Abbey, as a part of the Church of England. Today, the Abbey offers choir school, weddings, funirals, and tours.

properties.name: Williamsburg
properties.description: Posted by Ilovepeter11Williamsburg, VaWilliamsburg is a town full of American heritage. It wsa the first English settlement in North America. The whole focus of the city is the American Revolution. Across an area spanning 301 acres, there are over 500 restored historical buildings. Timeline, film, and outdoor reinactments are only some ways that one can experience Williamburg\'s history. There are so many ways to experience the rich history of America, and Williamsburg is a great way to learn about how soliders lived in the colionial days. A visit to Williamsburg is like taking a step back in time.

properties.name: Yosemite Natioal Park
properties.description: Posted by Ilovepeter11LocationYosemite Natioinal Park stretches throughout 1,170 miles of beauty. It is located in Central Califorinia. It\'s location is one a few short hours from majior cities such as Reno, San Fransisco, and Los Angels. There are nine locations where one can lodge, and plenty of shoppoing and dining to keep one occupied. Yosemite has many attractions for all ages and all skill levels. Snowboarding, snowshoeing, hiking, and swimming are just some of the activities avalible. Biking, rock climbing, mule and horseback rides, golfing, and guided bus tours are also some of the activities offered to visitors. Yosemite is also an ideal location for hosting parties, reunions and weddings. The park stays open all day every day.
